title: Greek political crisis looms over markets - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: european markets lose early gains as oil price plunges .
wall street opens lower after opec comments send oil price sliding .
fca chiefs lose bonuses over botched insurance review .
ukraine bonds hit by default fears .
greek stock market suffers fresh falls .
greek bonds fall again , driving yields higher .

text: and back to matters greek .
the country 's deputy premier evangelos venizelos is holding talks in berlin with the german finance minister wolfgang schauble at the start of a two-day visit to the country .

helena smith reports from athens : in what is being described as a well-timed visit aimed at apprising senior german officials about the situation on the ground in greece - and even more importantly in its parliament - venizelos kicked off his tour meeting the man who matters most .
the greek leader who is also foreign minister , has begun talks with schauble , regarded by policy gurus in athens as germany 's decision maker by excellence .
he is the one with the clout , the one who has the last say in financial affairs .
he is more important than [ german chancellor angela ] merkel , '' said one insider .
we see this meeting as being crucial to german understanding of the situation in greece and after the [ announcement of the ] presidential elections even more important than before . ''
german finance minister wolfgang schaeuble ( right ) and greek deputy prime minister evangelos venizelos .
photo : ap photo/michael sohn .
venizelos is expected to explain the make-up of the 300-seat house and the likelihood of the government winning its high stakes gamble to get a new president elected by the parliament .

germany 's stance , officially , is 'we do n't care what government is in power in athens ' but in reality it knows that if the [ presidential ] vote fails , elections are held , and syriza does come to power , things will likely be very difficult not just in greece but in the eurozone and right now germany is much more concerned about italy and france than greece .
it wants the situation in greece to be resolved . ''
the meeting comes amid much ado in athens over the lack of surprise that foreign lenders have shown over the presidential election - the acceleration of which sent shock waves through greece .

both schauble , and the eu economic affairs commissioner pierre moscovici , have appeared unfazed about the decision to bring the vote forward with moscovici saying openly that he had been informed of the move beforehand .
meanwhile the european commission , in an unusual move , backed greek prime minister antonis samaras ' choice for president in next week 's vote , former eu environment commissioner stavros dimas .
and on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments , and we 'll be back tomorrow .

documents.title: european markets lose early gains as oil price plunges
text: another slump in the oil price , with brent crude currently nearly 5 % lower at $ 63.67 a barrel after opec cut its demand forecasts for next year , has seen a turnaround in stock markets .
with energy companies under pressure , european markets have lost their early gains , with some ending in negative territory , while wall street is sharply lower in early trading .
the spectre of greek elections , with the far left syriza ahead in the polls , also continues to unsettle investors .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished 29.43 points or 0.45 % lower at 6500.04 germany 's dax added 0.06 % to 9799.73 france 's cac closed 0.84 % lower at 4227.91 italy 's ftse mib lost 0.89 % to 19,217.69 spain 's ibex ended down 0.62 % at 10,396.9 in greece , the athens market fell another 1.01 % to 893.71 on wall street the dow jones industrial average is currently down 149 points or 0.84 % .

another negative for the oil price from the latest us stocks report : forex.com ( @ forexcom ) # crude oil inventories increased 1.5 million barrels last week vs. a decline of 2.6m expected - # wti has dropped to a fresh low ^fr

documents.title: wall street opens lower after opec comments send oil price sliding
text: wall street has opened and has continued its downward move , with energy shares among the main fallers as the oil price hits new five year lows .
brent crude is currently more than 2 % lower at $ 65.36 as opec forecast lower demand for oil next year .
with demand slowing as the global economy slips back , the cartel forecast demand for its oil will be 28.92m barrels a day , down 280,000 barrels from its previous estimate .
so the dow jones industrial average is currently 122 points or 0.69 % lower while the s & p 500 is down 6.6 points or 0.32 % .
the uncertainty over greece after the announcement that the vote for a new president had been brought forward to next week also continues to unsettle investors .
the athens stock market is down around 0.59 % at the moment , off its worst levels of the day .
german and french markets have so far managed to remain in positive territory but the ftse 100 has lost its earlier gains and is now down around 9 points .

some early snaps from a speech by european central bank executive board member benoit coeure - rumoured to be one of those at odds with president mario draghi over policy - courtesy of reuters : 10-dec-2014 14:19 - ecb 's coeure says ecb has to show in a convincing way that we can bring inflation back towards 2 pct 10-dec-2014 14:20 - ecb 's coeure says euro zone fiscal stance is now broadly neutral and appropriate

documents.title: lunchtime round-up : greek fears hit bonds and shares again
text: time for a recap .
greek bonds yields have spiked again this morning , and shares have fallen further in athens , as the prospect of early general elections alarms investors for the second day running .
greek 10-year bonds are yielding 8.7 % , up from 8.1 % last night .
and three-year bonds are yielding over 9 % , meaning nervous investors are demanding a higher premium for short-term debt ( charts are here ) .
reuters this inverted yield curve '' suggests a higher risk of default - reflecting the fact that the left-wing syriza party , which wants a new debt write-down , is leading the opinion polls .

rabobank strategist lyn graham-taylor has told reuters : this inversion tells you that there is concern about further potential debt writedowns , and that is a function of minds being focused on syriza which would no doubt push hard for such a policy . ''
the cost of insuring greek bonds against default has also risen , driven by the possibility that the greek government 's nominee as president will be rejected this month .
the main greek index tumbled again , and is down almost 3 % this lunchtime .
banks are suffering again from fears that the debt crisis will be reignited .
yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) # greece - athens market down -3.0 % at 1300 gmt in a volatile session .
financials -5.4 % economists say that the gamble to call snap presidential elections show that greece 's debt crisis remains unresolved , five years after its first austerity programme .
marc ostwald of adm investor services reckons greece is heading for a showdown with its creditors , one way or another .

ostwald writes : prime minister antonis samaras 's gambit on calling a vote on the vexed issue of the presidency appears to have backfired , with all five opposition parties rejecting mr dimas as a candidate , which could of course in theory be resolved with an alternative candidate , but it would appear that the opposition are determined to force a general election , and with the hard-left syriza leading the polls , default and grexit risks are again looming in the headlights ( for reference syriza is expected to demand a 50 % write-off '' of its outstanding debt , and that the ecb buys all greek debt for many decades to come on a zero rate basis ) .
or are they ?

the truth of the matter is that greece 's budget and above all its debt position are simply not sustainable , nor indeed is any proposition of more austerity given that the domestic greek economy has already been decimated , and the voting public will simply not tolerate it .
a former pm has welcomed the snap presidential poll ( which will be voted on by mps this month , probably three times ) .
costas simitis predicted the move would make greece more stable ( video clip here ) .
one issue has been resolved ; hunger-striker nicos romanos will be allowed to attend university ( with conditions ) .
in other news senior staff at the uk 's financial regulator have been hit in the pocket after blundering over the announcement into an insurance industry probe this year .
fca chiefs lose bonuses after inquest into botched life insurance briefing but has the fca got off lightly ?

jeremy warner ( @ jeremywarneruk ) if the fca was a firm it regulates , it would take itself to the cleaners for the lapses identified in davis inquiry the oil price continues to fall today , with brent crude hitting a five-year low of $ 65.67 .
airlines , as well as consumers , should benefit .
the international air transport association ( iata ) has predicted that industry profits will hit a record this year .
and the lower oil price has also helped to trim britain 's trade gap ( but not by enough ) the opec cartel , though , says demand will be the lowest since 2002 .

world first ( @ world first ) opec says 2015 demand for its crude will be weakest in 12 years - sympathy also at all time lows and ukraine 's bonds have been hit hard by reports that it needs a larger bailout .
back to greece briefly , and it does appear that the athens government has climbed down over jailed hunger striker nicos romanos ( see earlier post ) .
the president of athens ' gennimatas hospital has declared that romanos will end his hunger strike , hours after intensifying it , in an attempt to gain access to university .

helena smith reports that the athens government tried to diffuse the situation with legislation allowing prisoners to attend university if they are tagged : supporters outside the hospital are shouting we are with you in whatever choice you make .
`` ; commentators saying that this is first time that government has been forced to stand down on an issue since the greek crisis began , helena adds .
yiannis βaboulias ( @ yiannisbab ) sigh of relief in # greece : # nromanos appears to accept the parliament 's ruling and stops his hunger strike .
he 'll be allowed to study .
it means politicians and greeks alike can focus on next week 's presidential elections

the fca is n't planning to offer compensation to anyone who lost out in the zombie fund probe debacle : jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) nine complains due to share price movements in march ; fca believes not liable shares in the industry tumbled at the start of trading , on the morning that the telegraph splashed that savers locked into 'rip-off ' pensions and investments may be free to exit '' , adding : the review , to begin this summer , will include pensions , endowments , investment bonds and life insurance sold by doorstep salesmen who were often spurred on by large commissions .
it took the fca until after 2pm to issue a statement clarifying the scope of the review into the life insurance business .
the fca 's chief executive , martin wheatley , has just been given a vote of confidence jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) i and so does my board have total confidence in martin wheatley - fca chair
those last tweets refer to clive adamson , the fca 's director of supervision , and zitah mcmillan , who ran its pr operations .
it emerged on monday that both are leaving the regulator .

more news from the fca briefing over its botched investigation into the life insurance industry : jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) fca chair insists adamson and mcmillan left as part of restructuring not because of davis report jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) fca chair : adamson and mcmillan `` done hell of a lot of good '' for the regulator

the fca 's chairman , john griffith-jones , has admitted that the zombie '' probe debacle has hurt its image : jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) `` i certainly believe our reputation has taken a knock '' - fca chair douglas fraser ( @ bbcdouglasf ) heads roll and a ceo bonus axed as fca regulator carpeted for shortcomings and mistakes in leaking price sensitive insurance market info

documents.title: fca chiefs lose bonuses over botched insurance review
text: breaking : the uk 's city watchdog has apologised for botching its investigation into britain 's pensions and insurance industry this year .

the financial conduct authority has accepted that it fell short '' back in march , when it briefed the daily telegraph that it was looking into the issue of 'zombie funds ' , where long-standing customers are locked into life insurance firms .
several top fca officials , including its boss martin wheatley , are losing bonuses .

an independent review by lawyers at clifford chance has found that the fca was wrong to pre-brief the telegraph , and then failed to react fast enough once shares in life insurance companies started tumbling .

the fca is facing the press now , my colleague jill treanor is there tweeting : jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) fca apologises for mistakes made in march over handling of briefing on insurance review jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) fca to block bonuses for top four officials - including boss martin wheatley - and cut 25pct off others jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) fca investigation cost £ 3.8m , £ 2m of which goes to clifford chance jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) davis said of fca briefing : high risk , poorly supervised , inadequately controlled

update : word from athens that mps may have voted to allow hunger-striking prison nikos romanos to attend university ( see previous post ) janine louloudi ( @ janinel83 ) # greece parliament unanimously accepts justic min amendment allowing # nromanos to attend uni wearing a bracelet .
spyros gkelis ( @ northaura ) # nromanos stops the hunger strike , according to genimatas hospital manager tr @ twitterid # antireport # rbnews # greece

as if the greek government did not have enough on its hands , news has come in that the jailed hunger-striking anarchist , nikos romanos , is now refusing to take liquids amid warnings from doctors that his condition has deteriorated dramatically .

helena smith reports from athens : i have just spoken to romanos ' father who confirmed that his 21-year-old son , who have been on hunger strike since november 10 , stopped taking liquids this morning .
he began refusing liquids a few hours ago , '' said giorgos romanos adding that until now he had accepted sugared tea , his only nourishment for the past four plus weeks .
his condition is very bad and very , very dangerous .
none of this would have happened if the government had met his request for educational leave . ''

a file photo taken on saturday , feb. 2 , 2013 shows robbery and terrorism suspect nikos romanos with heavy cuts and bruising as he is being led to a prosecutor to be charged in kozani , northern greece .

/ap the greek parliament is currently debating whether to allow romanos , who is currently serving a 16-year prison sentence for participating in an armed robbery of a bank , to attend university with an electronic tag .
he has accepted to wear the monitoring device , '' his father , a dentist , told me .
i very much hope the problem will be solved by the parliament today . ''
with tensions becoming ever more explosive , parties across the entire political spectrum have waded in , saying the time has come to bend the law by giving romanos the furlough .
he does n't want to escape , he wants to study , '' his lawyer , frangiscos ragoussis told reporters .
but the ruling centre right new democracy party along with the neo fascist group , golden dawn , are digging in their heels .

the justice minister charalambos athanasiou has repeatedly said that the letter of the law should be followed - although many believe that with the country now at the eye of an international storm and sparking market bedlam following the government 's decision to bring presidential elections forward , he may relent .

spyros gkelis ( @ northaura ) syriza mp : if the amendment actually gives # nromanos the right to study we will call romanos to stop the hunger-thirst strike '' # antireport should romanos die , greece 's ever-active anarchist and anti-establishment bloc , already baying for a fight over austerity , have pledged that the riots of 2008 ( sparked by the police shooting of 15-year-old alexis grigoropoulos who died in the arms of his best friend romanos ) will look like a kindergarden affair . ''
on saturday , as the country marked the sixth anniversary of the fatal shooting , riots erupted nationwide .
as solidarity rallies were stepped up today nationwide , doctors warned that they did not think romanos could hang on for long . ''
i will try to persuade him to stop if things get much worse , '' said his father .
i hope he will listen , but as you can see he is very stubborn and he sees this as an ethical stance , a moral battle that he wo n't surrender easily . ''
giorgos romanos leaving the maximos mansion on monday after a meeting with greece 's prime minister antonis samaras .
konstantinidis/reuters
the political instability in greece must be a nasty shock to the fund managers who took part in its debt auction earlier this year .
greece made a 'triumphant ' return to the bond markets in april , raising €3bn in new five-year bonds , at an average yield of 4.95 % .
it received €20bn of bids , from investors desperate to buy a bond with a decent rate of return .
the bond has subsequently fallen in value , pushing up its yield to around 8.6 % .
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) ouch !
investors have lost 14 % w/ 5yr greek bonds that were sold in spectacular auction in april2014 .
# greece of course , that does n't mean that bond-holders wo n't receive their regular interest payments , and then regain their capital in 2019 .
but it suggests it was n't the best trade of the year , as some other fund managers warned
the economist intelligence unit 's robin bew tweets : robin bew ( @ robinbew ) a real risk that # greece snap election will backfire and we end up with syriza running the show .
no wonder financial mkts going crazy .
the cost of insuring greek debt against default has spiked today .
data from markit shows that a greek credit default swap has jumped by almost 100 basis points , to 918bp .
that means it would cost €918,000 per year to insure €10bn of five-year greek bonds .

documents.title: ukraine bonds hit by default fears
text: the markets are turning against ukraine this morning .
the value of its bonds is falling , as the prospect of the ukranian government defaulting on its debts growth .

ukraine sovereign bond prices fall as much as 5 cents in dollar to trade 66-68 cents in dollar , traders say debt restructuring fears growing ukraine sovereign bond yield spreads widen 50 bps to new 5-yr high of 1669 bps over us treasuries yesterday , the imf warned of a $ 15bn black hole at the heart of ukraine 's bailout .
its economy has been ravaged by the conflict with russia , triggering a deep recession .
officials warned that it will hard to find more money for kiev .
britain 's trade deficit has fallen to a seven-month low , thanks to lower oil imports .
the ons reports that the gap between what the uk imported and exported fell to £ 2.0bn in october 2014 , down from £ 2.8bn september 2014 .
the country ran a £ 9.6bn goods deficit , versus a £ 7.6bn surplus on services..

rob wood of berenberg bank reckons the falling oil price should help trim the trade gap in the next few months : north sea oil platforms came back on-line [ in october ] , cutting the uk 's need to import energy , while lower oil prices might also have helped .
there will be more to come on that score .
the uk is a net oil importer , so weaker prices for the black gold should improve the uk 's trade balance .
the dreadful '' deficit in goods trade is nothing to crow about , wood added .
the selloff in greek bonds is accelerating , driving its short-term borrowing costs over 9 % : lemasabachthani ( @ lemasabachthani ) greek 3-year notes extend slump ; yield rises above 9 %
greece 's prime minister antonis samaras .
tsakalidis/konstantinos tsakalidis/demotix/corbis some background to the current crisis : the greek president is elected by the country 's mps , and a three-fifths majority is required .

greece 's coalition government only holds a narrow majority in the 300-seat parliament , and needs to persuade more than 20 opposition mps to back its candidate , stavros dimas at this month 's snap elections .
analysts at nomura predict that dimas will be rejected ( the final ballot is 29 december ) , triggering a general election .

efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) nomura : the government‟s decision to bring the presidential election forward was a necessity , it is upping pressure on syriza # greece efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) nomura : we continue to stand by our view that a failed vote and early elections is the baseline # greece

documents.title: greek stock market suffers fresh falls
text: the greek stock market has suffered fresh falls in early trading as investors scamper for cover ahead of this month 's snap presidential election .
the main athens index has shed another 2 % , led by banking stocks , adding to yesterday 's 13 % tumble .
greek stock market , december 10 2014 reuters greek stock market , december 10 2014 reuters squawk box europe ( @ squawkboxeurope ) greek banks hard hit this morning .
athens stock market down 2.4 % # greece steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) greek banks heavy again natl bank , alpha , piraeus all down 5 % plus
the oil price is down again this morning , with brent crude dropping by 1.4 % to $ 65.90 per barrel .
david papier , market analyst at etx capital , blames global growth concerns and political uncertainty in greece '' .
over in the uk parliament , the treasury committee is about to quiz the head of the office for budget responsibility .
expect lots of questions about chancellor george osborne 's plan to eliminate the deficit in the next parliament , and slash public spending , as a percentage of gdp , to its lowest since the 1930s .
my colleague andrew sparrow is live-blogging it all here : mps question obr 's robert chote about autumn statement : politics live blog
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) inverted curve for greece 3 years at 9 % ; 10 years at 8.35 % - clearest possible sign of distress

documents.title: greek bonds fall again , driving yields higher
text: greek government bond prices are falling again this morning as the prospect of a new political crisis sends shivers though the market .
the selloff is driving the interest rate , or yield , on greek bonds higher into the danger zone where it would struggle to finance itself .
greece 's 10-year bond yield has risen by 43 basis points ( or 0.43 % ) to 8.55 % this morning , according to tradeweb data .
greek 10-year bond yields over the last four months .
reuters and the three-year bond yield has spiked to 8.83 % , from 8.2 % last night .

greek 3-year bond yields this month reuters that means that the greek yield curve has 'inverted ' , in city jargon , at the prospect that this month 's presidential ballot will trigger a snap general election early next year .
basically , investors are demanding a bigger rate of return for holding debt that matures in 2017 , rather than in 2024 .

and that suggests a bigger risk of default , or restructuring , in the near term ( usually a country have to pay more to borrow for a longer period , as there 's a greater danger of something turning nasty ) .

alberto costa ( @ gigiocamicio ) # greek bonds fall , yield curve inverted for balance , though , yields are much much lower than during the height of the eurozone crisis : phillipa lj ( @ phillipalj ) for context on greece , here are yields on greek 10-yr gov bonds since 'whatever it takes ' and kit juckes of societe generale reckons it might all be a storm in a teacup '' : a de facto confidence vote in the current administration is a high stakes gamble and could yet cause wider market distress but so far , the spill over outside equity markets is limited .
greek government bond spreads relative to bunds are back at levels last seen a couple of weeks ago , and the blip in portuguese/german spreads is almost invisible .
either this is a christmassy story that makes newspaper headlines but has little market impact , or bond ( and fx ) markets are wilfully complacent .
in the uk , one of the hawkish members of the bank of england has declared that interest rates may need to rise soon .
ian mccafferty , who has voted for rate rises in recent meetings , argues that wage growth has - finally !
- reached a turning point , which could require higher borrowing costs .

overall , i think that the risks around our central estimate of slack in the november inflation report are probably skewed to the downside , and that in practise there may not be that much spare capacity left in the labour market . ''
but with inflation at 1.3 % , and heading lower , most city economists do n't expect rates to rise until well into 2015 , or even longer .
european stock markets have risen in early trading , clawing back some of yesterday 's losses .
the french cac is up 0.85 % , the german dax is up 1 % , and the ftse 100 has gained 0.5 % .

cunard/rex this blogpost by channel 4 's paul mason explains why the greek crisis has leapt up the agenda : the greek endgame begins in it , he explains how the left-wing syriza party will push for new debt write-offs if it wins power , and why that is alarming investors in eurozone bonds : one investment briefing i 've seen says there is a chance angela merkel will agree to a comprehensive greek bailout , signalling the first steps to a fiscal union .
but the danger is that in spain , where syriza 's ally podemos also tops the polls , momentum builds there for a general write off of peripheral european debt .
given that even the financial times thinks this is the best way out for europe we might then be at a tipping point .
there 's a lot of ifs in this scenario : the presidential election has to fail , syriza has to win , its leader alexis tsipras has to stick to his hard line .
but none of it is impossible - which is why the greek stock market fell 9 per cent on monday night 's news .
get the popcorn in , everyone .

greece 's deputy prime minister , evangelos venizelos , is due to meet with german finance minister wolfgang schäuble later today : yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) # greece fm venizelos to meet schäuble later today in berlin .
that could be interesting .

ian williams , analyst at peel hunt , sums up the city 's concerns about greece : 'grexit ' had fallen off the list of things that european investors are worried about but it returned with a vengeance yesterday ; the prospect of a presidential vote in greece next week , followed by a general election which ( based on current poll ratings ) could see the syriza party in government saw investors take fright .
such an administration would be highly unlikely to follow the fiscal constraints imposed by the imf/eu bailout plan , and much more likely to prioritise how to exit the bailout .

documents.title: french industrial output slides
text: bad news from france this morning - industrial production shrank by 0.8 % in october , dashing hopes of a 0.2 % rise .
that means france 's industrial sector is 1 % smaller than a year ago , after 12 months of weak economic growth .
olly barratt ( @ ollybarratt ) ouch .
rt @ twitterid : french oct. industrial production fell 0.8 % vs month ago

documents.title: former greek pm : we ca n't afford another crisis
text: one of greece 's ex-prime ministers has welcomed the decision to bring forward the presidential elections to next week ( from february ) .
costas simitis , who was pm from 1996 to 2004 - taking greece into the euro - said the current leader antonis samaras has made a wise move .
it would have been worse to let the presidential election battle hang over greece , as it tries to negotiate the final stage of its bailout with lenders .

now greece has the possibility to elect the president , to have elections , to have a new government and a new government will discuss with the european union about the future of the greek economy and greek debt , if this was not done , there would be a situation of nobody knowing what will happen and of crisis - and crisis is not a good thing . `` .
costas simitis on cnbc

the greek drama also makes the front page of the financial times today , who report : greece 's political woes re-erupted as a threat to global financial stability yesterday , triggering the biggest drop on the athens stock exchange since the 1980s and sending reverberations through world markets .
neil henderson ( @ hendopolis ) ft : snap election in greece reignites fears for eurozone # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers

yesterday the athens stock market suffered its biggest one-day fall in over 20 years ; syriza politicians apparently reckon its a conspiracy to hit their support : yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) # greece - mixed views on how market will react today following yday 's massacre .
syriza mps describe crash as 'terrorist act against syriza ' .

documents.title: the agenda : greek politics back in focus
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , the eurozone and business .
this is usually a quiet time in the financial calendar , as investors look to hold onto this year 's profits ( or forget about this year 's losses ) .
but that 's all out of the window , thanks to the political instability gripping greece .
yesterday 's stock market wobbles shows how the city is alarmed by the prospect of the left-wing leader alexis tsipras slipping into the prime minister 's chair in athens .

global stock markets tumble as antonis samaras calls snap election and with the first round of the snap presidential election due in a weeks 's time , events in athens are being closely watched around the globe .
overnight , japan 's nikkei index has fallen by 2.3 % to a two-week low as the political uncertainty - and lower oil prices - hit sentiment .
volatility is rising too : holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) there is nervousness out there as # volatility surges across the board .
nikkei vol up 14 % , vix at 1mth high .

european stock markets are expected to stage a small recovery , but it could be a nervy day : here 's the market calls : ftse100 is expected to open 33 points higher at 6,552 dax is expected to open 68 points higher at 9,861 cac40 is expected to open 27 points higher at 4,290 there 's not much in the diary but we are expecting french industrial production data shortly , and uk trade data at 9.30am .
european central bank policymaker benoît cœure is giving a speech in brussels this lunchtime .

he reportedly opposed president mario draghi this month over the commitment to widen the ecb 's balance sheet robert chote , the head of the uk 's office for budget responsibility , is appearing before the treasury committee to discuss the autumn statement .

yesterday , those mps heard that the fall in the oil price should soon push down petrol prices : petrol to fall to £ 1 a litre if oil prices remain low , treasury mps told we 'll be tracking all the main events through the day

bulletin.text: All the latest economic and financial news, as the Greek presidential election spooks investors.
Summary: Greek bonds and shares hit again.
City watchdog faces music over zombie fund probe fiasco.
